ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Broad Work Adjustment (BWA)Total Raw Score
Broad Work Adjustment (BWA) Percentile
Broad Work Adjustment (BWA) T-Score
Broad Work Adjustment (BWA)Work Placement
Notes: 1=Community-competitive; 2=Transitional; 3=High Sheltered; 4=Low Sheltered; 5=Work Activity; 6=Day Care

ElementDescription: Broad Work Adjustment (BWA)Work Support Needs
Notes: 1=Limited; 2=Low; 3=Moderate; 4=High; 5=Extensive

ElementDescription: PERSONAL HYGIENE: Bathes, washes, and uses deodorants to maintain body cleanliness
Notes: 0=Neglects body care, Dirty; 1=Often unclean, Body odor; 2=Usually clean, Occasional odor; 3=Frequently clean, No body odor; 4=Regularly clean, No body odor

ElementDescription: RESTROOM USE: Demonstrates self-care toileting tasks -uses toilet tissue appropriately flushes toilet after use, washes and dries hands, closes door.
Notes: 0=Consistently neglects most toileting tasks; 1=Often neglects some toileting tasks; 2=Occasionally neglects a toileting task; 3=Seldom neglects a toileting task; 4=Consistently performs toileting tasks

ElementDescription: PERSONAL RELATIONS: Courteous and respectful toward co-workers and supervisors
Notes: 0=Rude, Uses profanity; 1=Often impolite; 2=Ordinarily polite; 3=Courteous, Polite; 4=Exceptional relations

ElementDescription: GROUP ACCEPTANCE: Approval and acceptance by co-workers
Notes: 0=Avoided by others, Disliked; 1=Has few friends, Tolerated by others; 2=Generally liked by others; 3=Well-liked by most; 4=Sought after by others

ElementDescription: COOPERATION-Supervisors: Attitude toward supervisors as authority figures
Notes: 0=Defiant, Antagonistic; 1=Often critical of authority; 2=Ordinarily cooperative; 3=Respectful, Cooperates well; 4=Highly cooperative

ElementDescription: TRUSTWORTHY: Reliable and trusting in relations with others
Notes: 0=Cannot be trusted; 1=Questionable at times; 2=Generally trustworthy; 3=Reliable, Dependable; 4=Consistently trustworthy

ElementDescription: COOPERATION-Co-workers: Ability to get along with others
Notes: 0=Troublemaker, Poor relations; 1=Has difficulty, Quick to argue 2=Usually cooperative; 3=Gets along well; 4=Excellent relations

ElementDescription: CONCERN FOR OTHERS: Interest in co-worker's welfare
Notes: 0=Self-centered, Not concerned; 1=Indifferent; 2=Somewhat concerned; 3=Attentive, Group oriented; 4=Actively concerned

ElementDescription: ACCEPTING CORRECTION: Accepts criticism and correction from supervisors
Notes: 0=Refuses, Poor acceptance; 1=Indifferent, Apathetic; 2=Generally accepting; 3=Accepts well; 4=Actively accepting

ElementDescription: EMOTIONAL STABILITY: Reaction to handling problems or frustration in the work situation
Notes: 0=Hyperemotional, May be unresponsive; 1=Is easily upset; 2=Usually well-balanced; 3=Good control of feelings; 4=Exceptionally stable

ElementDescription: SOCIAL PARTICIPATION: Interacts with co-workers in social activities
Notes: 0=Does not join in; 1=Limits participation; 2=Usually participates; 3=Frequently joins in; 4=Always joins in

ElementDescription: APPROPRIATE CLOTHING: Wears appropriate dress in the work situation
Notes: 0=Never wears proper clothing; 1=Often dress is inappropriate; 2=Usually dress is appropriate; 3= 3 Frequently wears proper dress; 4=Regularly wears proper dress

ElementDescription: HELPING OTHERS: Offers help or work assistance to co-workers without being told
Notes: 0=Offers no help; 1=Seldom offers help; 2=Usually offers help; 3=Frequently offers help; 4=Actively helpful

ElementDescription: CHANGES IN ROUTINE: Response to change in work routine or job assignment
Notes: 0=Actively refuses, Becomes upset; 1=Displays reluctance, Grudgingly accepts; 2=Accepts change, but needs encouragement; 3=Accepts change; 4=Willingly accepts change

ElementDescription: MAJOR DISRUPTIVE BEHAVIOR: Frequency of major disruptive behavior for a randomly selected work week
Notes: 0=6 or more times per week; 1=3-5 times per week; 2=2 times per week; 3=1 time per week; 4=0 times per week

ElementDescription: NUMBERS: Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide correctly
Notes: 0=No concept of numbers; 1=Does simple addition; 2=Simple addition and subtraction; 3=Adds, subtracts, and multiplies; 4=Uses all numbers skills

ElementDescription: COMMUNICATION MODE: Uses gestures, signs, or verbal expression to communicate
Notes: 0=Uses non-verbal language; 1=Some verbal and manual; 2=Generally verbal; 3=Uses verbal expression well; 4=Excellent verbal use

ElementDescription: MEMORY: Remembers orally given information or work instructions
Notes: 0=Poor memory, Limited recall; 1=Often forgets simple information; 2=Usually recalls procedures and information; 3=Good recall of information; 4=Excellent recall for details

ElementDescription: READING LEVEL: Reads with comprehension or understanding
Notes: 0=Non-reader; 1=Reads various survival signs; 2=Reads grade levels 3-5; 3=Reads grade levels 6-8; 4=Reads above 8th grade

ElementDescription: TIME CONCEPT: Knows the meaning of the concepts-yesterday, tomorrow, day after tomorrow, and days of the week
Notes: 0=No understanding of time concepts; 1=Understands 1 of 4 concepts; 2=Understands 2 of 4 concepts; 3=Understands 3 of 4 concepts; 4=Understands all time concepts

ElementDescription: WRITING: Ability to communicate in print or cursive writing
Notes: 0=No attempt to write or print; 1=Writes or prints own name; 2=Writes or prints up to two words; 3=Writes or prints simple messages; 4=Writes letters with correct grammar

ElementDescription: TELLING TIME: Tells time correctly on a standard face clock or watch
Notes: 0=Cannot tell time; 1=Tells time by the hour; 2=Tells time to half hour; 3=Tells time by 5-minute intervals; 4=Tells time to the minute

ElementDescription: PERSONAL APPEARANCE: Maintains a neat appearance and personal grooming
Notes: 0=Ill-groomed, Sloppy; 1=Often unkempt; 2=Usually well-groomed; 3=Well-groomed, Neat; 4=Exceptional personal appearance

ElementDescription: TELEPHONE: Receives and makes phone calls and uses telephone white and yellow pages
Notes: 0=Answers phone, takes no messages; 1=Converses, takes simple messages; 2=Uses phone to call familiar numbers; 3=Uses pay telephone; 4=Gets information from directories

ElementDescription: MEASURING: Ability to measure items of different lengths accurately
Notes: 0=Grossly limited; 1=Measures to the inch; 2=Measure to the 1/2 inch; 3=Measures to the 1/4 inch; 4=Measure to the 1/6 inch

ElementDescription: MANAGING MONEY: Banking, budgeting, and daily money handling tasks
Notes: 0=Cannot manage money; 1=Manages with close supervision; 2=Manages with occasional supervision; 3=Manages with minimal supervision; 4=Manages own money

ElementDescription: DISCRIMINATION SKILLS: Ability to match or sort items by size
Notes: 0=Grossly limited; 1=Frequently makes errors; 2=Makes few errors; 3=Nearly perfect discrimination; 4=Perfect discrimination

ElementDescription: COMMUNICATING BASIC NEEDS: Informs supervisor of thirst, hunger, toilet, illness, or other basic needs.
Notes: 0=Does not make needs know; 1=Seldom describes needs; 2=Generally makes needs known; 3=Often describes needs; 4=Regularly states needs

ElementDescription: FOLLOWING VERBAL INSTRUCTIONS: Ability to carry out work instructions.
Notes: 0=Becomes confused, Unable to follow; 1=Has difficulty with simple instructions; 2=Follows most instructions fairly well; 3=Follows most instructions well; 4=Skillfully follows all instructions

ElementDescription: KNOWLEDGE OF WORK: Understands the current job and methods or materials used
Notes: 0=Almost none, Inferior; 1=Somewhat limited; 2=Generally knowledgeable; 3=Good understanding of most phases; 4=Excellent understanding of all phases

ElementDescription: TRANSFER OF SKILLS: Ability to transfer skills acquired on one task to a new task
Notes: 0=Unable to transfer with help; 1=Transfers with help; 2=Transfers with moderate help; 3=Transfers with little help; 4=Actively transfers skills

ElementDescription: SOLVING PROBLEMS: Solves own problems with job tasks or co-worker
Notes: 0=Almost never; 1=Seldom finds solutions; 2=Usually makes progress; 3=Solves most problems; 4=Solves all problems

ElementDescription: LEARNING JOB TASK: Ability to learn job assignments with help
Notes: 0=Unable to learn; 1=Slow in learning; 2=Moderate learner; 3=Fast learner; 4=Very rapid learner

ElementDescription: PUNCTUALITY: Promptness for reporting to work at starting times in the morning, after lunch, and after break periods for a randomly selected 20-day work period.
Notes: 0=Always late, No concept of time; 1=Often late; 2=Generally on time; 3=Nearly always on time; 4=Consistently on time

ElementDescription: JUDGMENT: Ability to make work-related decisions
Notes: 0=Disorganized, Consistently makes incorrect decisions; 1=Somewhat limited, Frequently makes incorrect decisions; 2=Generally logical, Usually makes correct decisions; 3=Plans well, Frequently makes correct decisions; 4=Resourceful, Consistently makes correct decisions

ElementDescription: INDEPENDENT TRAVEL: Uses public or private conveyance independently to work
Notes: 0=Cannot travel independently; 1=Uses public transit between learned sites; 2=Uses public transit between unfamiliar sites; 3=Uses personal transportation; 4=Makes long distance trips

ElementDescription: CORRECTING ERRORS: Controls own quality of work.
Notes: 0=Almost never; 1=Makes few corrections; 2=Corrects most errors; 3=Corrects all but a few; 4=Corrects all errors

ElementDescription: QUALITY OF WORK: Maintains production standards of neatness and accuracy of tasks or product produced
Notes: 0=Consistently inferior work; 1=Frequently below requirements; 2=Meets requirements; 3=Frequently above requirements; 4=Regularly above requirements

ElementDescription: INITIATING TASK: Self-initiates daily work routine
Notes: 0=Almost never; 1=Often needs to be shown; 2=Usually initiates; 3=Often initiates, Self-reliant; 4=Always initiates, Highly self-directed

ElementDescription: QUANTITY OF WORK: Maintains production rates of volume or amount of acceptable work completed
Notes: 0=Limited output, Below 25% of norm; 1=Low output, 25-49% of norm; 2=Moderate output, 50-75% of norm; 3=High output, 76-90% of norm; 4=Extended output, Over 90% of norm

ElementDescription: ASKING FOR MATERIALS: Makes requests for needed materials or supplies to complete assignment.
Notes: 0=Does not ask, Sits idle; 1=Seldom asks, Wastes time; 2=Ordinarily asks; 3=Frequently asks; 4=Actively seeks needed materials

ElementDescription: DEPENDABILITY: Fulfills assignments in a reliable and dependable manner
Notes: 0=Unreliable, Requires close supervision; 1=Requires frequent checking; 2=Generally reliable; 3=Seldom needs checking; 4=Highly reliable, Conscientious

ElementDescription: INDEPENDENT FUNCTIONING: Amount of supervision required after initial instruction period.
Notes: 0=Requires constant supervision; 1=Often requires assistance; 2=Occasionally requires assistance; 3=Seldom requires assistance; 4=Independent, Requires no assistance

ElementDescription: REQUESTS HELP WHEN NEEDED: Seeks necessary help or assistance from supervisors in the work area.
Notes: 0=Does not seek needed help; 1=Seldom seeks needed help; 2=Usually seeks needed help; 3=Frequently seeks needed help; 4=Always seeks needed help

ElementDescription: MOTIVATION: Initiative and interest when performing job assignments
Notes: 0=Indifferent, Needs constant pushing; 1=Often needs prodding to do assigned work; 2=Somewhat motivated with assigned work; 3=Considerably motivated with assigned work; 4=Highly motivated, Seeks additional new work

ElementDescription: TOOL RETURN: Returns tools or supplies to appropriate location after use.
Notes: 0=Requires constant reminding; 1=Requires frequent reminding; 2=Generally returns items; 3=Nearly always returns items; 4=Regularly returns items

ElementDescription: ATTENDING TO TASK: Amount of effort applied to the job assignment
Notes: 0=Inattentive, Distractable; 1=Often wastes time; 2=Generally keeps busy; 3=Steady worker; 4=Extremely industrious

ElementDescription: MAINTAINING WORK AREA: Cleans up work area during and after production.
Notes: 0=Does not clean up; 1=Does some cleaning; 2=Does a fair job; 3=Does a good job; 4=Does a thorough cleaning

ElementDescription: TIME CLOCK: Clocks in and out correctly when arriving in the morning and leaving after work
Notes: 0=Consistently makes errors; 1=Often makes errors; 2=Occasionally makes errors; 3=Rarely makes errors; 4=Makes no errors

ElementDescription: WORK STEADINESS: The amount of time spent in steady or productive work during a randomly selected work period.
Notes: 0=Minimal, Less than 10 minutes; 1=Low moderate, 11 to 30 minutes; 2=Moderate, 31 to 60 minutes; 3=High moderate, 61 to 120 minutes; 4=Extended, More than 2 hrs.

ElementDescription: CARE OF EQUIPMENT: Uses tools and equipment properly on job assignment
Notes: 0=Breaks equipment, Careless; 1=Often misuses; 2=Occasionally misuses equipment; 3=Rarely misuses equipment; 4=Consistent proper use

ElementDescription: SAFETY PRACTICE: Compliance with safety rules and regulations to minimize accidents.
Notes: 0=Does not comply; 1=Seldom complies, Takes chances; 2=Usually careful, Takes few chances; 3=Careful worker, Rarely takes chances; 4=Complies with all regulations

ElementDescription: COMMUNICATING PROBLEMS: Reports problems in the work area to supervisors
Notes: 0=Rarely or never reports problems, 0-24% of the time; 1=Seldom reports problems, 25-49% of the time; 2=Usually reports problems, 50-75% of the time; 3=Often reports problems, 76-89% of the time; 4=Always reports problems, 90-100% of the time

ElementDescription: PHYSICAL STAMINA: Physical capacity to maintain a fairly consistent work pace for a normal workday
Notes: 0=Minimal endurance and energy; 1=Tires easily, Often needs rest; 2=Fairly good endurance; 3=Good endurance, Rarely needs to rest; 4=Exceptional vigor and energy

ElementDescription: FINE MOTOR SKILL: Finger manipulation of small parts or small products assembling.
Notes: 0=Poor finger dexterity; 1=Has difficulty, Slow; 2=Fairly good dexterity; 3=Good precision skill; 4=Excellent precision skill

ElementDescription: ATTENDANCE: Frequency of absences for a randomly selected 20-day work period
Notes: 0=Has more than 5 absences; 1=Has 3 to 5 absences; 2=Has 2 absences; 3=Has 1 absence; 4=Attends regularly, No absences

ElementDescription: MANUAL SKILL: Working with the hand or hands in stapling, sorting, or machine operating and other manual tasks.
Notes: 0=Limited manual skill; 1=Clumsy; 2=Generally good manual skill; 3=Good manual skill; 4=Excellent manual skill

ElementDescription: GROSS MOTOR SKILL: Coordination of arms and legs in tasks requiring lifting, carrying, pushing, or pulling.
Notes: 0=Poor motor coordination; 1=Awkward, Unsteady; 2=Fairly good coordination; 3=Good motor coordination; 4=Exceptional motor coordination

ElementDescription: WORK STATION: Remains in the immediate work area and does not wander
Notes: 0=Wanders constantly; 1=Often wanders from work area; 2=Occasionally may leave work area; 3=Seldom leaves work station; 4=Regularly at work station

ElementDescription: PHYSICAL STRENGTH: Ability to lift, carry, push, or pull objects of various weights.
Notes: 0=Sedentary work, Lifts to 10 lbs.; 1=Light work, Lifts to 20 lbs.; 2=Medium work, Lifts to 50 lbs.; 3=Heavy work, Lifts to 75 lbs.; 4=Very heavy work, Lifts over 75 lbs.

ElementDescription: DEPENDABILITY: Fulfills assignments in a reliable and dependable manner
Notes: 0=Requires close supervision, Unreliable; 1=Requires frequent checking; 2=Generally reliable; 3=Seldom needs checking; 4=Highly reliable, Conscientious

ElementDescription: WORK POSTURE: Works with good posture and positioning
Notes: 0=Poor posture, Slouched; 1=Awkward posture; 2=Fairly good posture; 3=Good posture; 4=Excellent posture

ElementDescription: EATING HABITS: Demonstrates appropriate use of utensils, acceptable table habits, and polite requests for table items
Notes: 0=Poor eating habits, Untidy; 1=Often untidy eating habits; 2=Fairly good manners and eating habits; 3=Good manners and eating habits; 4=Exceptional manners and eating habits

Cognitive Skills Domain Raw Score Total
Notes: sum(bwap_23, bwap_24, bwap_25, bwap_26, bwap_27, bwap_28, bwap_29, bwap_30, bwap_31, bwap_32, bwap_33, bwap_34, bwap_35, bwap_36, bwap_37, bwap_38, bwap_39, bwap_40, bwap_41)

Interpersonal Relations Work Placement

Work Performance Work Placement
